DOC.brief_summary: The overall objective determine visual outcomes cost perform Manual Small Incision Cataract Surgery ( MSICS ) small cohort academic medical center United States . The primary outcome measure percentage study group achieve post operative visual acuity 20/40 Snellen . This percentage compare historical cohort report phacoemulsification cataract surgery ( PCS ) , perform academic center . A secondary outcome determine actual institutional cost provide MSICS set academic medical center . The hypothesis MSICS appropriate teaching environment ( evidence comparable rate 20/40 acuity well 90 day post op , compare PCS ) , provide cost make visual rehabilitation affordable uninsured underinsured .

DOC.criteria: 1 . Age 21 year old ( adult ) . 2 . Medically Stable , able safely undergo surgery . 3 . Nuclear sclerotic cataract 4 . Preoperative best correct visual acuity ( BCVA ) 20/80 bad 5 .
